page.title: 04Recreation in Ashby
page.content: Some of the hobbies that the people of Ashby do are crafts of various sorts, flower arranging,baking,sewing and dancing. There is a playing field for the children which has got swings,a slide, and parallel bars. There is no cricket field or football pitch.The only people who go riding are the owners of the pub.They keep horses and may go riding with the Pytchley hunt. There are footpaths from Ashby to Barby,Kilsby,Welton,Braunston and Watford.The local wildlife may be seen on walks along these paths-the increasing number of badgers,monkjack deer,foxes,rabbits,hares and pheasants. Unfortunately Dutch elm disease led to the felling of over 2,000 elms in 1978, but new plantings include sycamorere, oak,ash and rowan trees.
